A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: While definitely stronger than it's predecessor\, as well as boasting some strong visuals and direction by Johnson; The Last Jedi still can't quite soar to the levels of the original's it so desperately wishes it can with a dull second-act\, as well as some meaningless plot lines. The film truly kicks into high-gear in it's last forty-five minutes. As for the changes and twists\, it isn't as shocking or heartbreaking as fans would make you believe\, a lot of overreaction is definitely present. When it's good\, it is really good! But when it's bad\, it's really bad. \n\n2.5/5 stars
